prompt: <description>**Construct a three-dimensional rectangular prism with a cylindrical hole in the center. The prism has a flat base and a flat top. The cylindrical hole is centered within the prism. The dimensions of the prism are 4 units by 6 units by 8 units. The cylindrical hole has a diameter of 2 units.** **Part 1** Begin by creating a new coordinate system with the following parameters: * Euler Angles: `[0.0, 0.0, -90.0]` * Translation Vector: `[0.0, 0.3493, 0.0]` Next, create the 2D sketch for the first part with the following components: * Face 1 + Loop 1 - Line 1: Start Point `[0.0, 0.0]`, End Point `[0.6875, 0.0]` - Line 2: Start Point `[0.6875, 0.0]`, End Point `[0.3438, 0.75]` - Line 3: Start Point `[0.3438, 0.75]`, End Point `[0.0, 0.0]` + Loop 2 - Circle 1: Center `[0.3438, 0.2564]`, Radius `0.1375` Note that Loop 1 forms the rectangle for the prism, while Loop 2 forms the cylindrical hole. To complete the part, set the scaling parameter for the sketch to `0.75`, and then transform the 2D sketch into a 3D sketch using the coordinate system parameters. Finally, extrude the 2D sketch to generate the 3D model. Set the extrusion depths to `0.3493` towards the normal and `0.0` opposite the normal. This will create the first part of the prism with the cylindrical hole in the center. The length of this part is `0.75` units, the width is `0.3493` units, and the height is `0.75` units. The final shape of the completed CAD model will be a three-dimensional rectangular prism with a cylindrical hole in the center. The prism has a flat base and a flat top. The cylindrical hole is centered within the prism. The dimensions of the prism are 4 units by 6 units by 8 units. The cylindrical hole has a diameter of 2 units.</description>
